definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
to reflect (light)/to shine/to project (an image onto a screen etc)
room/work unit/grave/scabbard/family or clan/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy

sentences.english: Mr. President? The fate of Jon Snow is about to be revealed in the screening room.
sentences.chinese: 總統先生？雪諾的命運將在放映室揭曉。

sentences.english: The library has a screening room and wet bar.
sentences.chinese: 圖書館有一個放映室和酒吧。

sentences.english: They took me into a projection room to see a picture.
sentences.chinese: 他們把我帶到放映室去看一張圖。

sentences.english: The Building also has two film theatres for screening students' experimental productions.
sentences.chinese: 此外，大樓還設有兩個放映室，讓同學試影實驗作品。

sentences.english: Piddington library is a small independent village library.
sentences.chinese: 電影庫是一個小型的村莊放映影片的放映室。

definition: to reserve all the seats (or a large block of seats) at a theater, restaurant etc
box (in a theater or concert hall)/private room (in a restaurant or karaoke)
teahouse/tea-stall with seats/tea-garden or teahouse seat
